definition: to prepare herbal medicine by roasting or parching (in a pan)
to sauté/to fry/to dry by heating

sentences.english: Soon after this, the Chinese started making firecrackers and fireworks.
sentences.chinese: 不久後，中國人便製造了炮竹及煙火。

sentences.english: The next morning, with the sound of firecrackers, the dock gate closure ceremony was held.
sentences.chinese: 次日上午，在炮竹聲中，塢門合攏儀式正式舉行。

sentences.english: Firstly, fireworks and crackers can cause sound pollution.
sentences.chinese: 第一，燃放煙花炮竹會引起噪音污染。

sentences.english: It's an old custom to set off firecrackers during Spring Festival.
sentences.chinese: 春節的時候燃放炮竹，是個古老的民俗。

sentences.english: Thirdly, fireworks and crackers can cause damage.
sentences.chinese: 第三，煙花炮竹會造成一些破壞。

definition: firecrackers set off at the stroke of midnight on New Year's Day (a Chinese tradition)
ritual money made of paper burnt for the Gods or the dead
sky lantern (miniature hot-air balloon used during festivals)
joss paper made to resemble paper money
joss paper made to resemble paper money
